subject: Politics
title: What Is Political Economy
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Is Political Economy usable.

hook.text: Economics pretends to be neutral. Political economy admits the truth: every economic choice is political.

buildup.text: Political economy studies how politics shapes economic decisions and how economics shapes political power.

discovery.text: Adam Smith, Karl Marx, and John Maynard Keynes all studied political economy. It was once the core of economics.

twist.text: Modern economics split from politics to seem scientific. But taxes, trade, and spending are never just math.

climax.text: Every budget reveals a nation's true priorities. Who gets money and who pays for it is always political.

punchline.text: Economics without politics is fiction. Every number has a winner and a loser.

quiz.question: What does political economy study?
options: How politics shapes economic decisions and vice versa
Only the mathematical models of markets
